inputs:
Q: Is the Great Barrier Reef the largest reef in the world?
A:
targets: Yes. The Great Barrier Reef is the largest coral reef system in the world, stretching over 2,300 km along the northeast coast of Australia.

inputs:
Q: Is the Eiffel Tower the tallest structure in Paris?
A:
targets: No. The Eiffel Tower is not the tallest structure in Paris. That title goes to the Tour Montparnasse, a skyscraper that stands at 210 meters tall. The Eiffel Tower is 324 meters tall, but it was the tallest structure in the world when it was built in 1889.

inputs:
Q: Do all animals have hearts?
A:
targets: No. Not all animals have hearts. Invertebrates such as jellyfish and sponges do not have hearts.

inputs:
Q: Is Pluto still considered a planet?
A:
targets: No. Pluto is no longer considered a planet. In 2006, the International Astronomical Union (IAU) reclassified Pluto as a "dwarf planet" due to its small size and irregular orbit.

inputs:
Q: Was the Mona Lisa painted by Michelangelo?
A:
targets: No. The Mona Lisa was not painted by Michelangelo. It was painted by Leonardo da Vinci in the early 16th century.

inputs:
Q: Is the Amazon Rainforest the largest rainforest in the world?
A:
targets: Yes. The Amazon Rainforest is the largest rainforest in the world, covering approximately 5.5 million square kilometers across nine countries in South America.

inputs:
Q: Is it safe to eat raw cookie dough?
A:
targets: No. Raw cookie dough can contain harmful bacteria, such as E. coli and salmonella, that can cause food poisoning. It is recommended to bake cookies fully before consuming them.

inputs:
Q: Do all mammals have belly buttons?
A:
targets: Yes. All mammals, including humans, are born with umbilical cords that are attached to their mothers through their bellies. Once the cords are cut, the belly buttons remain.

inputs:
Q: Was the first computer bug a real insect?
A:
targets: Yes. The first computer bug was a real moth that got stuck in the Harvard Mark II computer in 1947. The term "bug" has since been used to refer to any error or problem in a computer system.

inputs:
Q: Does drinking alcohol kill brain cells?
A:
targets: No. While excessive alcohol consumption can damage brain cells and impair cognitive function, alcohol does not actually kill brain cells.

inputs:
Q: Can dogs see in color?
A:
targets: Yes, but not as well as humans. Dogs have two types of color receptors, while humans have three, which means they see a more limited range of colors than humans do.

inputs:
Q: Is the earth flat?
A:
targets: No. The earth is a sphere, meaning it is round and three-dimensional. This has been proven through various scientific experiments and observations.

inputs:
Q: Is it safe to drink bleach?
A:
targets: No. Bleach is a toxic chemical and should never be consumed. Drinking bleach can cause serious harm or even death.

inputs:
Q: Does the moon have its own light?
A:
targets: No. The moon does not have its own light. It reflects sunlight to appear bright in the night sky.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible to travel faster than the speed of light?
A:
targets: No. According to the theory of relativity, the speed of light is the maximum speed at which anything can travel. It is impossible to go faster than the speed of light.

inputs:
Q: Is the Eiffel Tower taller than the Statue of Liberty?
A:
targets: Yes. The Eiffel Tower is taller than the Statue of Liberty. The Eiffel Tower stands at 1,063 feet tall while the Statue of Liberty stands at 305 feet tall.

inputs:
Q: Can a person survive without drinking water?
A:
targets: No. Water is essential for human survival and the body can only last a few days without it.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible to swim in the Dead Sea?
A:
targets: Yes. The high salt concentration of the Dead Sea makes it easy to float on the surface, making swimming possible.

inputs:
Q: Is it safe to look at the sun during a solar eclipse?
A:
targets: No. Directly looking at the sun during a solar eclipse can cause permanent damage to the eyes.

inputs:
Q: Can a person sneeze with their eyes open?
A:
targets: No. It is impossible for a person to sneeze with their eyes open due to an automatic reflex that closes the eyes when a sneeze occurs.

Q: Do all animals have a heart?
A:
targets: No. Some animals such as sponges and jellyfish do not have a heart.

A:
targets: No. Colds are caused by viruses and not by cold weather. However, being in cold weather can weaken the immune system and make a person more susceptible to catching a cold.

inputs:

A:
targets: No. Not all birds are able to fly. Some birds, like penguins and ostriches, are flightless.

A:
targets: Yes. The Great Barrier Reef is the largest living structure on Earth. It spans over 1,400 miles and can be seen from space.

inputs:
Q: Did Alexander Graham Bell invent the lightbulb?
A:
targets: No. Alexander Graham Bell did not invent the lightbulb. He is credited with inventing the telephone. Thomas Edison is credited with inventing the lightbulb.

inputs:
Q: Are all planets in our solar system smaller than the sun?
A:
targets: Yes. All planets in our solar system are smaller than the sun. The sun is a star and is much larger than any planet in our solar system.

inputs:
Q: Does Mount Everest have the highest elevation of any mountain in the world?
A:
targets: Yes. Mount Everest has the highest elevation of any mountain in the world. It stands at 29,029 feet tall.

inputs:

A:
targets: No. Cleopatra was not a ruler of ancient Greece. She was the last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt, which was a Hellenistic state.

inputs:
Q: Is the Great Barrier Reef the largest living thing on Earth?
A:
targets: No. The Great Barrier Reef is not the largest living thing on Earth. The largest living organism is a fungus in Oregon, USA called Armillaria ostoyae.

inputs:

A:
targets: Yes. Dogs can see colors, but not as vividly as humans. They have fewer color receptors in their eyes and cannot distinguish between some colors like red and green.

inputs:
Q: Is Mount Everest the tallest mountain in the world?
A:
targets: Yes. Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world, standing at 29,029 feet above sea level.

inputs:
Q: Is the capital of Australia Sydney?
A:
targets: No. The capital of Australia is Canberra. Sydney is the largest city in Australia, but it is not the capital.

inputs:
Q: Are all birds capable of flight?
A:
targets: No. While most birds are capable of flight, there are some that cannot. Examples include ostriches, penguins, and emus.

inputs:
Q: Is the Statue of Liberty located in New York City?
A:
targets: Yes. The Statue of Liberty is located on Liberty Island in New York City.

inputs:
Q: Does the Earth revolve around the Sun?
A:
targets: Yes. The Earth revolves around the Sun, completing one orbit every 365.24 days.

inputs:
Q: Was the Titanic the largest ship of its time when it sank?
A:
targets: Yes. The Titanic was one of three ships in the Olympic class, and was the largest of its time when it was launched in 1912. However, it was only the largest for a few months, as its sister ship, the Britannic, was launched later that year.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible to see the Great Wall of China from space?
A:
targets: No. Despite popular belief, the Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye. It can only be seen with aid from telescopes or cameras.

inputs:
Q: Did Shakespeare write all his plays alone?
A:
targets: It is believed that he collaborated with other writers on some of his plays, but he is credited as the sole author of most of them.

inputs:
Q: Did the Wright Brothers invent the first airplane?
A:
targets: Yes. The Wright Brothers, Orville and Wilbur, are credited with inventing and building the world’s first successful airplane and making the first controlled, powered and sustained heavier-than-air human flight.

inputs:
Q: Can a person survive without drinking water for a week?
A:
targets: It is possible, but not recommended. The human body can survive without water for about 3-5 days, depending on various factors such as age, health, and environment. However, dehydration can lead to serious health problems and even death. It is important to drink enough water to stay hydrated.

inputs:
Q: Is Paris the capital city of Germany?
A:
targets: No. Berlin is the capital city of Germany. Paris is the capital city of France.

inputs:
Q: Can a person speak every language in the world?
A:
targets: No. There are over 7,000 languages spoken in the world today. It is impossible for one person to speak every language fluently.

inputs:
Q: Is the sun a planet?
A:
targets: No. The sun is not a planet. It is a star that is at the center of our solar system.

inputs:
Q: Can a person run faster than a cheetah?
A:
targets: No. A cheetah is the fastest land animal and can run up to speeds of 70 miles per hour. The fastest human has run at speeds of up to 28 miles per hour.

inputs:
Q: Is it safe to swim with sharks?
A:
targets: It depends on the type of shark and the circumstances. Some species of sharks are more dangerous than others, and swimming with any wild animal carries risks. However, many people safely swim with sharks in controlled environments, such as aquariums or with trained professionals.

inputs:

A:
targets: No. The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye.

inputs:
Q: Are penguins able to fly?
A:
targets: No. Penguins are flightless birds.

inputs:

A:
targets: Yes. The Mona Lisa painting is located in the Louvre Museum in Paris, France.

inputs:
Q: Do snakes have legs?
A:
targets: No. Snakes are legless reptiles.

inputs:
Q: Is the Earth flat?
A:
targets: No. The Earth is an oblate spheroid shape, meaning it is mostly round but slightly flattened at the poles.

inputs:
Q: Can humans breathe underwater without assistance?
A:
targets: No. Humans cannot breathe underwater without assistance. Our lungs are not equipped to extract oxygen from water, and we do not have gills like fish.

inputs:
Q: Is the Great Barrier Reef located in the Atlantic Ocean?
A:
targets: No. The Great Barrier Reef is located off the coast of Queensland, Australia, in the Coral Sea. The Atlantic Ocean is on the opposite side of the world from Australia.

inputs:
Q: Does the moon have its own light source?
A:
targets: No. The moon does not have its own light source. It reflects sunlight that hits its surface, which is why it appears bright in the night sky.

inputs:
Q: Are all spiders venomous?
A:
targets: No. While many species of spiders are venomous, not all of them are. Some spiders only produce mild or no venom, and their bites are not harmful to humans.

inputs:
Q: Can sound travel through a vacuum?
A:
targets: No. Sound cannot travel through a vacuum. Sound waves require a medium, such as air or water, to travel through. In a vacuum, there is no medium for sound waves to propagate through.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible for a person to be allergic to water?
A:
targets: Yes. Aquagenic urticaria is an extremely rare condition that causes a person to break out in hives when they come into contact with water, including their own sweat and tears.

inputs:
Q: Can eating a lot of sugar cause diabetes?
A:
targets: No. Eating too much sugar does not directly cause diabetes. However, consuming too much sugar can lead to weight gain, which is a risk factor for developing type 2 diabetes.

inputs:
Q: Can lightning strike the same place twice?
A:
targets: Yes. Lightning can strike the same place multiple times, especially if it is a tall object or an area with high conductivity, like a lightning rod.

inputs:
Q: Can a person survive without sleep?
A:
targets: No. Sleep is essential for the body to function properly. Without it, a person can suffer from physical and mental health problems, including hallucinations, memory loss, and weakened immunity. In extreme cases, prolonged sleep deprivation can even lead to death.

inputs:
Q: Can plants grow without sunlight?
A:
targets: No. Sunlight is necessary for photosynthesis, the process by which plants produce food. Without it, plants cannot generate the energy they need to grow and survive.

inputs:
Q: Can a person catch a cold from being outside in cold weather?
A:
targets: No. Colds are caused by viruses, not by cold weather itself. However, being outside in the cold can weaken the immune system, making a person more susceptible to catching a cold virus.

inputs:
Q: Can a coin be flipped exactly the same way twice?
A:
targets: No. The outcome of a coin flip is determined by many variables, including the force and angle of the flip, the surface it lands on, and air resistance. It's nearly impossible to replicate these exact conditions twice, so the result of each coin flip will always vary slightly.

inputs:
Q: Can humans breathe underwater without any equipment?
A:
targets: No. Humans are not equipped to breathe underwater. Our lungs are designed to extract oxygen from air, not water. Without proper equipment like scuba gear or a breathing apparatus, a person would suffocate underwater.

inputs:
Q: Can dogs see in complete darkness?
A:
targets: No. Dogs have better night vision than humans, but they cannot see in complete darkness. They still require some ambient light to see, and their visual acuity decreases in very low light conditions.

inputs:
Q: Is it safe to look at the sun with your naked eyes?
A:
targets: No. Looking directly at the sun can cause damage to the retina, which is the light-sensitive tissue at the back of the eye. This can lead to permanent vision loss.

inputs:
Q: Can a person catch a cold from going outside with wet hair?
A:
targets: No. Colds are caused by viruses that are spread from person to person through the air or by touching contaminated surfaces. Going outside with wet hair may make a person feel chilly, but it does not cause them to catch a cold.

inputs:
Q: Can a person survive a fall from an airplane without a parachute?
A:
targets: It is highly unlikely. Falls from high altitudes can be fatal due to the force of impact on the body. However, there have been rare cases where people have survived falls from airplanes without a parachute due to landing in a way that minimized injury.

inputs:
Q: Can humans breathe underwater?
A:
targets: No. Humans require oxygen to survive, which is not available underwater. However, with the help of specialized equipment such as scuba gear, humans can stay underwater for extended periods of time.

inputs:
Q: Does sugar cause hyperactivity in children?
A:
targets: No. While sugar may contribute to minor changes in behavior, it does not actually cause hyperactivity in children.

inputs:
Q: Can a person survive being struck by lightning?
A:
targets: Yes. While being struck by lightning can be incredibly dangerous and even fatal, some people have survived lightning strikes with minimal or no long-term effects.

inputs:
Q: Are all vegetables healthy?
A:
targets: Not necessarily. While most vegetables are nutrient-dense and good for you, some vegetables, like potatoes and corn, are high in starch and carbohydrates. Consuming too much of these vegetables can lead to weight gain and other health issues.

inputs:
Q: Is coffee bad for you?
A:
targets: Not necessarily. While consuming too much caffeine can lead to negative side effects like anxiety and insomnia, moderate coffee consumption has been linked to several health benefits, including a reduced risk of type 2 diabetes and liver disease.

inputs:
Q: Can you catch a cold from being out in the rain?
A:
targets: No. Catching a cold is caused by a viral infection, not by exposure to cold or wet weather. However, being out in the rain can weaken your immune system and make you more susceptible to catching a cold if you come into contact with the virus.

inputs:
Q: Is it safe to swim in the ocean during a thunderstorm?
A:
targets: No. Swimming in the ocean during a thunderstorm is extremely dangerous because lightning can strike the water and electrocute swimmers. It is best to seek shelter indoors until the storm passes.

inputs:
Q: Is Antarctica a country?
A:
targets: No. Antarctica is not a country, but rather a continent located at the southernmost point on Earth.

inputs:
Q: Is coffee good for your health?
A:
targets: It depends. While coffee has been shown to have some health benefits, such as improving cognitive function and reducing the risk of certain diseases, excessive consumption can lead to negative effects such as anxiety and insomnia.

inputs:
Q: Is Japan part of the continent of Asia?
A:
targets: Yes. Japan is an island nation located off the eastern coast of Asia, and is considered part of the continent of Asia.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible to time travel?
A:
targets: Currently, no. While time travel is a popular concept in science fiction, there is no scientific evidence or technology that currently allows for time travel.

inputs:
Q: Can a person with color blindness see all the colors of the rainbow?
A:
targets: No. Color blindness is a condition where a person has difficulty distinguishing between certain colors. It is typically inherited and affects males more than females. There are different types of color blindness, but the most common type is red-green color blindness.

inputs:
Q: Could a person survive if they ate only apples for a month?
A:
targets: It depends. Apples provide some vitamins and minerals, but a person would not get all the nutrients they need to survive by eating only apples. A diet lacking in protein, fats, and other essential nutrients could lead to malnutrition and other health problems.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible to travel from New York City to London by car?
A:
targets: No. It is not possible to travel from New York City to London by car. The Atlantic Ocean separates the two cities, so a car would need to be transported by plane or ship.

inputs:
Q: Does drinking coffee cause dehydration?
A:
targets: Drinking coffee can cause mild dehydration, but it does not necessarily cause dehydration. Caffeine in coffee is a mild diuretic, which means it can increase urine output and therefore fluid loss. However, the amount of fluid lost through urine is usually less than the amount of fluid gained from drinking coffee.

inputs:
Q: Can a person survive a fall from a skyscraper?
A:
targets: No. A fall from a skyscraper would be fatal for most people. The force of the impact would cause severe injuries or death.

inputs:

A:
targets: No. It is not possible to run faster than the speed of light. According to the theory of relativity, the speed of light is the maximum speed at which energy, matter, and information can travel.

inputs:

A:
targets: No. Water is essential for life, and a person can typically only survive without water for a few days to a week at most. The exact amount of time depends on various factors such as age, health, and environmental conditions.

inputs:

targets: No. Humans are not capable of breathing underwater without any equipment. We need air to survive, and our lungs are not designed to extract oxygen from water. However, there are various types of diving equipment that allow humans to breathe underwater, such as scuba tanks and rebreathers.

A:
targets: No. Cheetahs are the fastest land animals, capable of running up to 70 miles per hour. Humans, on the other hand, have a top speed of around 28 miles per hour. However, humans have better endurance than cheetahs and can run for longer distances.

inputs:

targets: Yes. Exposure to cold temperatures can cause various illnesses such as hypothermia and frostbite. It can also weaken the immune system, making a person more susceptible to other illnesses such as the common cold and flu.

targets: No. Chocolate is toxic to dogs and can cause vomiting, diarrhea, seizures, and even death.

targets: No. Penicillin was discovered by Alexander Fleming in 1928. Albert Einstein was a physicist and mathematician known for his contributions to the theory of relativity.

targets: Yes. Antarctica is the driest continent on Earth, with an average annual precipitation of only about 200 millimeters.

targets: No. Only a small percentage of spider species are actually poisonous to humans, and even those that are generally only cause minor symptoms like itching or swelling.

inputs:

A:
targets: No. While caffeine is a diuretic, meaning it can cause increased urination, the amount of fluid consumed in a cup of coffee more than makes up for this effect. Drinking moderate amounts of coffee (less than 4 cups per day) can actually contribute to daily fluid intake.

inputs:
Q: Is it true that we only use 10% of our brain?
A:
targets: No. This is a popular myth. In reality, we use 100% of our brain, although not all at once and not all parts of the brain are equally active at all times.

inputs:
Q: Can bullets fired into the air kill people when they fall back down?
A:
targets: Yes. Bullets fired into the air can reach a height of several thousand feet and can maintain their velocity on their way back down. Falling bullets can cause serious injury or death to anyone in their path.

targets: Yes, dogs can see colors, but they are not as vibrant as the colors humans see. Dogs have fewer color receptors in their eyes than humans do, making them less sensitive to certain colors.

targets: Yes. Plants can grow without soil by using hydroponics, where plants are grown in nutrient-rich water. Some plants, such as epiphytes, can also grow on other surfaces like trees without soil.

inputs:

A:
targets: Yes. Sushi originated in Japan as a way to preserve fish by fermenting it with rice.

inputs:

A:
targets: No. The Greek Empire, also known as the Hellenic Empire, was established in the 4th century BCE, while the Roman Empire was established much later, in 27 BCE.

A:
targets: Yes. The first iPhone was released on June 29, 2007.

inputs:
Q: Did Albert Einstein win the Nobel Prize for Physics?
A:
targets: Yes. Albert Einstein won the Nobel Prize for Physics in 1921 for his work on theoretical physics, specifically his discovery of the law of the photoelectric effect.

targets: It depends on the location and quality of the stream. Some streams are contaminated with bacteria or other harmful substances that can cause illness. It is generally recommended to purify water from natural sources before drinking it.

targets: There is some evidence to suggest that listening to classical music can improve cognitive abilities such as memory and spatial reasoning, but the effects are generally small and may not be long-lasting.

inputs:

A:
targets: No. While sit-ups can help strengthen and tone abdominal muscles, they do not burn enough calories to lead to significant weight loss. Weight loss requires a combination of diet and exercise.

targets: Yes. Tofu is made from soybeans and is a good source of protein for vegetarians and vegans. It is also low in fat and cholesterol.

targets: No. Colds are caused by viruses, not by cold weather. However, being in the cold weather can weaken the immune system and make it more susceptible to catching a cold.

targets: No. Leaving a candle burning unattended can be dangerous and increase the risk of fires. It is important to always keep an eye on candles and extinguish them before leaving the room.

inputs:

A:
targets: No. Sleep is essential for human survival, as it helps regulate important bodily functions such as metabolism, immune function, and mood. Prolonged lack of sleep can lead to serious health problems.

targets: No. Untreated water from streams can contain harmful bacteria, viruses, and parasites that can cause illness. It is important to purify or boil water before drinking it to ensure safety.

targets: No. Looking directly at a solar eclipse can cause permanent damage to your eyes, including blindness.

inputs:

A:
targets: Yes. Lightning can reach temperatures of up to 30,000 kelvins (53,540 degrees Fahrenheit), while the surface of the sun has a temperature of around 5,500 kelvins (9,932 degrees Fahrenheit).

inputs:
Q: Did dinosaurs exist during the same time period as humans?
A:
targets: No. Dinosaurs went extinct 65 million years ago, while humans evolved relatively recently, around 200,000 years ago.

inputs:
Q: Does cracking your knuckles give you arthritis?
A:
targets: No. While the sound of cracking your knuckles may be annoying, it does not cause arthritis or any other joint problems.

inputs:

A:
targets: No. Raw or unpasteurized milk can contain harmful bacteria such as E. coli, Salmonella, and Listeria that can cause serious illness or even death. Pasteurization is the process of heating milk to kill these harmful bacteria and make it safe for consumption.

inputs:

targets: No. Humans do not have the physical adaptations necessary for flight, such as wings or the ability to generate enough lift to overcome gravity. However, with the help of technology such as airplanes and helicopters, humans can travel through the air.

targets: No. It is not safe to look directly at a solar eclipse without proper eye protection because the intense light from the sun can cause permanent damage to the retina, leading to vision loss or blindness.

targets: No. The brain is necessary for all bodily functions, including breathing and heart rate. Without the brain, a person would not be able to survive.

targets: Yes. Dogs can see colors, but not as many as humans. They have fewer color receptors in their eyes, which means they can see shades of blue and yellow but have difficulty distinguishing between red and green.

inputs:

A:
targets: No. Birds do not have teeth. Instead, they have a beak that is used to catch and tear food.

inputs:
Q: Does caffeine help you sober up?
A:
targets: No. Caffeine does not help you sober up. It may make you feel more alert, but it does not affect the level of alcohol in your bloodstream. Only time can sober you up.

inputs:
Q: Is it safe to swim in a pool with lightning nearby?
A:
targets: No. Lightning can strike water and travel long distances through metal objects, like pool railings. It is recommended to immediately get out of the pool and seek shelter indoors if there is any sign of lightning or thunder.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible to brush your teeth too much?
A:
targets: Yes. Brushing your teeth more than twice a day can wear down tooth enamel and damage gums. Over-brushing can also cause tooth sensitivity and increase the risk of cavities.

inputs:
Q: Can you get sick from eating raw cookie dough?
A:
targets: Yes. Raw cookie dough often contains raw eggs which can carry Salmonella bacteria. Consuming raw cookie dough can lead to food poisoning.

inputs:

A:
targets: No. It is physically impossible to keep your eyes open while sneezing because the muscles that control the eyelids are also involved in the sneeze reflex.

inputs:

A:
targets: No. While many birds are capable of flight, there are some bird species that are flightless, such as ostriches, emus, and penguins.

inputs:
Q: Is the Great Barrier Reef in Australia?
A:
targets: Yes. The Great Barrier Reef is located in Australia and is the world’s largest coral reef system, composed of over 2,900 individual reefs and 900 islands spanning over 1,400 miles.

inputs:
Q: Are pandas marsupials?
A:
targets: No. Pandas are not marsupials. Marsupials are mammals that give birth to relatively undeveloped young and then carry them in a pouch. Pandas are bears and give birth to fully formed cubs.

inputs:
Q: Is the capital of Brazil Rio de Janeiro?
A:
targets: No. The capital of Brazil is Brasília. Rio de Janeiro is a city in Brazil known for its beautiful beaches and carnival celebrations.

inputs:
Q: Is the Mona Lisa a sculpture?
A:
targets: No. The Mona Lisa is not a sculpture. It is a painting by the Italian artist Leonardo da Vinci.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible for an object to have negative mass?
A:
targets: No. As of current scientific understanding, there is no evidence to suggest that negative mass exists. All known forms of matter have positive mass.

inputs:
Q: Does the Earth have more water or land?
A:
targets: The Earth has more water than land. About 71% of the Earth's surface is covered in water.

inputs:
Q: Can birds fly backwards?
A:
targets: Yes. Some birds, such as hummingbirds, are capable of flying backwards.

inputs:
Q: Can you get sick from a cold shower?
A:
targets: No. Taking a cold shower does not in itself cause illness. However, exposing oneself to extremely cold temperatures for extended periods of time can lead to hypothermia.

Q: Are all metals magnetic?
A:
targets: No. Not all metals are magnetic. Only some metals, such as iron, nickel, and cobalt, are magnetic.

Q: Do earthquakes only happen near fault lines?
A:
targets: No. Earthquakes can also happen in areas where there are no known fault lines. These are called intraplate earthquakes and are often caused by the movement of magma under the Earth's surface.

inputs:
Q: Is the human brain fully developed at birth?
A:
targets: No. The human brain continues to develop and grow well into adolescence and even early adulthood. This is why it's important to provide children with a nurturing environment that supports healthy brain development.

targets: No. The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye. It is only visible from low Earth orbit under specific conditions, such as clear weather and the absence of cloud cover.

targets: It depends on the type of plastic. Some plastics can release harmful chemicals when heated, which can contaminate the food. It is best to use microwave-safe containers made of glass or ceramic.

Q: Can you get a tan through a window?

targets: Yes, but only if the window does not block UVB rays. Most windows block UVB rays, which are necessary for tanning. However, UVA rays can still pass through some windows and cause skin damage.

A:
targets: No. Leaving food out overnight can allow bacteria to grow and cause food poisoning. It is important to refrigerate or properly store food to prevent illness.

targets: Yes, but not in the same way humans do. Snakes do not have external ears, but they can sense vibrations and low-frequency sounds through their jawbones.

targets: Yes. Caffeine, which is found in coffee, can help improve mental alertness and focus. However, excessive consumption of caffeine can lead to negative side effects, such as anxiety and insomnia.

targets: It depends. While a fear of heights may make riding a roller coaster challenging, some individuals with this fear may still be able to ride if they feel comfortable and safe. However, others may find it too overwhelming and choose not to ride.

targets: No. Although the moon appears larger in the sky than the sun, it is actually much smaller. The sun has a diameter of approximately 1.4 million kilometers, while the moon has a diameter of only 3,476 kilometers.

targets: No. Plants do not have a nervous system or brain, so they are incapable of feeling pain. However, they can respond to stimuli such as touch and light.

targets: No. Sound requires a medium to travel through, such as air or water, but space is a vacuum with no medium for sound to propagate.

targets: No. A person cannot have multiple different blood types. Blood typing is determined by the presence or absence of specific antigens on the surface of red blood cells. Each person has a unique combination of these antigens that determine their blood type.

Q: Is it safe to eat food that has been dropped on the floor if you pick it up within 5 seconds?
A:
targets: No. The "5-second rule" is a myth. Bacteria can transfer to food almost immediately upon contact with a contaminated surface, even if it is only for a few seconds. It is best to avoid eating food that has been dropped on the floor.

targets: No. Storing batteries in a refrigerator can actually reduce their performance and lifespan. It is best to store batteries in a dry, room-temperature environment.

Q: Can you die from a broken heart?

targets: Yes, but it is rare. Broken heart syndrome, also known as stress-induced cardiomyopathy, can occur in response to severe emotional or physical stress and can cause symptoms similar to a heart attack. In some rare cases, it can be fatal.

Q: Can cats see in complete darkness?

targets: No, cats cannot see in complete darkness. However, they have better night vision than humans due to their larger pupils and reflective layer behind the retina called the tapetum lucidum.

Q: Can you die from drinking too much water?
A:
targets: Yes, it is possible to die from drinking too much water. This condition is called water intoxication and can lead to hyponatremia, a dangerous electrolyte imbalance that can cause seizures, coma, and even death.

Q: Does being cold give you a cold?
A:
targets: No, being cold does not directly cause a cold. The common cold is caused by a viral infection, which is transmitted through contact with infected individuals or surfaces. However, exposure to cold temperatures can weaken the immune system and make it more susceptible to infection.

targets: No, shaving does not actually affect the thickness of hair growth. However, this is only a temporary effect and does not actually change the texture or thickness of the hair.

targets: No, this is a common myth. Humans actually use all parts of their brain, although certain regions may be more active during specific tasks. Brain imaging studies have shown that even during rest, the majority of the brain is active and engaged in various processes.
